alert.note: Alert for Northern Washoe County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 1:25PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...SERIES OF WINTER STORMS WILL BRING WIDESPREAD IMPACTS TO THE AREA THROUGH MID-WEEK... * A relatively weak system will move into the area Saturday. Light snowfall accumulations of up to 2 inches is possible in the remote portions of northern Washoe county, with light snow or rain/snow mix at most other locations including the Surprise Valley. * A second system will quickly arrive early Sunday. Another 1 inch or less of snowfall can be expected. Combined liquid totals from rain and snow will generally be 0.15 inches or less across the area. * A potent Atmospheric River is still expected to impact the area Monday into Tuesday of next week. This system will bring copious amounts of moisture and precipitation to the region. Along river basins and cities that predominately see just rainfall, urban and small stream flooding concerns is likely. However, there is a high degree of uncertainty in snow levels, especially on Monday during the onset of the storm. Conditions are favorable for heavy/wet snow with high precipitation rates on Monday, even in the lowest valleys. With that said, there is an equal chance that snow levels will remain elevated and we could see rounds of heavy rainfall. This will mean the difference of more widespread flooding concerns or heavy/wet snowfall. Impacts are likely either way, so it is advised to check roadway conditions before the Monday morning commute.
